result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J. Knoeck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waupaca County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Ch. 961.  
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present. 
Defendant shall not associate with anyone that has possession of, or that uses, illegal substances defined in Ch. 961. 
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV. 
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his/her system. 
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: C: Defendant, DOC
C: Defendant, DOC

Defendant Anthony J. Knoeck in court with attorney Genelle M. Johnson. 
John P Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant questioned and advised of rights. 
No contest plea entered. 
The Court accepts the no contest plea entered and finds the defendant guilty. 
State has complied with victim notifications. 
Sentence recommendations by counsel. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 2 years probation, concurrent with 16CM70 & 16CT116. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961 
- not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present 
- not associate with anyone in possession of, or that uses, illegal substances defined in Ch. 961 
- not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV 
- not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any amount of alcohol in his/her system 
- not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood 
Advised of appeal rights.
